data.message: Always trust in Facebook for the right answers to questions we need to know, thank you Facebook.

replies.message: Anytime, Judy. We're glad we could help. Stay safe out there! -Jordan
What the the reason behind this.
I messaged you and you don't even read my message, i got a problem and I thought you could help me! What does it mean? Ignoring me?
What a bunch of Kool Aid drinking coo coos!!! Left of Lenin, and beyond ignorant, from Zuckerputz on down to the PR people online!!!
Judy, ur trust in any company is very misplaced !! If FB is your only source of info or guidance in your life, well, IMO u should get help from a real human being in the flesh as in person!!

Facebook: I just completed a chat with somebody identifying themselves as Edmondson Kirsten, who says she works for FB, which she does. I looked up her account and she does exist. However, somebody using her name said I had won a lottery from FB in the amount of $600,000 USD (that they used USD made me suspicious, as that is the phrasing the Nigerian scammers use). They then said I had to visit your HQ in Menlo Park, CA or pay an Administrative and Delivery Fee of ONLY $300.00. I've been around long enough to be able to smell a scam like this a mile away. I have two questions: it's a hoax, correct? Also, does Ms. Kirsten need to take steps to protect her account? Thanks.
